column2: death=Fate unknown (set sail in about [[878 AD]] but never returned)

column1: '''Éadwine''' was a [[Man]] living in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglo-Saxon_England Anglo-Saxon England] in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/9th_century 9th century AD]. He was the father of a famous seafarer [[Ælfwine]], the first mortal to find the [[Straight Road]] in thousands of years since [[Eärendil]].
In about [[878 AD]] he set sail in his ship [[Éarendel]] but was never seen again. His fate remains unknown.<ref>{{SD

column2: Edwin]]) contains the elements ''ead'' "bliss" (seen also in ''[[Éadig]]'') and ''wine'' "friend".<ref>{{webcite
